column6: In the last 4 weeks, how frequently did you or anyone in your household worry you would not have enough water for all of your household needs?
column10: 0=never(0 times); 1=rarely(1-2 times); 2=sometimes(3-10 times); 3=often/always (11 times or more)

column6: In the last 4 weeks, how frequently has your main water source been interrupted or limited (e.g. lower water pressure, less water than expected, less rain, etc)?
column10: 0=never(0 times); 1=rarely(1-2 times); 2=sometimes(3-10 times); 3=often/always (11 times or more)

column6: In the last 4 weeks, how frequently have problems with water meant that clothes could not be washed?
column10: 0=never(0 times); 1=rarely(1-2 times); 2=sometimes(3-10 times); 3=often/always (11 times or more)

column6: In the last 4 weeks, how frequently have you or anyone in your household had to change schedules or plans due to problems with your water situation? (Activities that may have been interrupted include caring for others, doing household chores, being late for school or work, sleeping, etc.)
column10: 0=never(0 times); 1=rarely(1-2 times); 2=sometimes(3-10 times); 3=often/always (11 times or more)

column6: In the last 4 weeks, how frequently have you or anyone in your household had to change what was being eaten because there were problems with water (e.g., for washing foods, cooking, etc.)?
column10: 0=never(0 times); 1=rarely(1-2 times); 2=sometimes(3-10 times); 3=often/always (11 times or more)

column6: In the last 4 weeks, how frequently have you or anyone in your household had to go without washing hands after dirty activities (e.g., defecating or changing diapers,) because of problems with water?
column10: 0=never(0 times); 1=rarely(1-2 times); 2=sometimes(3-10 times); 3=often/always (11 times or more)

column6: In the last 4 weeks, how frequently have you or anyone in your household had to go without washing their body because of problems with water (e.g., not enough water, dirty, unsafe)?
column10: 0=never(0 times); 1=rarely(1-2 times); 2=sometimes(3-10 times); 3=often/always (11 times or more)

column6: In the last 4 weeks, how frequently has there not been as much water to drink as you would like for you or anyone in your household?
column10: 0=never(0 times); 1=rarely(1-2 times); 2=sometimes(3-10 times); 3=often/always (11 times or more)

column6: In the last 4 weeks, how frequently did you or anyone in your household feel angry about your water situation?
column10: 0=never(0 times); 1=rarely(1-2 times); 2=sometimes(3-10 times); 3=often/always (11 times or more)

column6: In the last 4 weeks, how frequently have you or anyone in your household gone to sleep thirsty because there wasn’t any water to drink?
column10: 0=never(0 times); 1=rarely(1-2 times); 2=sometimes(3-10 times); 3=often/always (11 times or more)

column6: In the last 4 weeks, how frequently has there been no useable or drinkable water whatsoever in your household?
column10: 0=never(0 times); 1=rarely(1-2 times); 2=sometimes(3-10 times); 3=often/always (11 times or more)

column6: In the last 4 weeks, how frequently have problems with water caused you or anyone in your household to feel ashamed, excluded, or stigmatized?
column10: 0=never(0 times); 1=rarely(1-2 times); 2=sometimes(3-10 times); 3=often/always (11 times or more)

column6: 14_Comments
ID
16_I will present you some scenarios and for each one, I would like you to tell me how sufficient you think is the water each person receives.
column13: 16_Le voy a presentar algunos escenarios y para cada uno, me gustaria que me dijera, que tan suficiente considera que es el agua que la persona recibe: (1) no es suficiente para actividades diarias (2) moderadamente suficiente (3) casi suficiente (4) completamente suficiente.

column6: 16_1_Maria gets water from the public supply one day per week, from 6am to 12pm. How sufficient is the water Maria receives for her daily tasks?
column10: 1 = not sufficient for daily activities, 2 = slightly sufficient, 3 = almost sufficient, 4 = completely sufficien

column6: 16_3_Paola receives water from the public supply three days per week. On those days, she gets water all day. How sufficient is the water Paola receives for her daily tasks?
column10: 1 = not sufficient for daily activities, 2 = slightly sufficient, 3 = almost sufficient, 4 = completely sufficien

column6: 16_5_Luisa receives water from the public supply five days per week. On those days, she gets water all day. How sufficient is the water Luisa receives for her daily tasks?
column10: 1 = not sufficient for daily activities, 2 = slightly sufficient, 3 = almost sufficient, 4 = completely sufficien

column6: 16_99_Now I would like you to think in your own water situation, and in how much water you receive during a normal week. How sufficient is the water you get over a week for your daily tasks?
column10: 1 = not sufficient for daily activities, 2 = slightly sufficient, 3 = almost sufficient, 4 = completely sufficien
